snippet: The recent kidnappings of more than 140 have demonstrated not only the high level of insecurity in the area, but also the determination of residents to defuse tensions.
abstract: Kidnappings of more than 140 people have provoked fears of expanded sectarian conflict in Syria’s northern Idlib Province; one set of hostages is released in good condition after negotiations between residents of two affected villages; kidnappings for money or political reasons have become common in Syria as government control has eroded.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

lead_paragraph: The recent kidnappings of more than 140 have demonstrated not only the high level of insecurity in the area, but also the determination of residents to defuse tensions.

headline.seo: Syrian Kidnappings Raise Fear of Expanded Conflict
headline.main: Syrians Freed in Abductions That Stoked Fears of More Strife
headline.print_headline: Syrians Freed in Abductions That Stoked Fears of More Strife

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
